t: Psalm 9
Prayer and Thanksgiving for the Lord’s Righteous Judgments
To the Chief Musician. To the tune of “Death of the Son.” A Psalm of David.
I*pn will praise You,*i O Lord,*s with my whole heart; I*ld will tell of all Your marvelous works.
I*ld will be glad and rejoice in You; I*ld will sing praise to Your name, O Most High.
When*ln my enemies turn back, They*ld shall fall and perish at Your presence.
For*ld You have maintained my right and my cause; You*ld sat on the throne judging in righteousness.
You*ld have rebuked the nations, You*ld have destroyed the wicked; You*ld have blotted out their name forever and ever.
O*ln enemy, destructions are finished forever! And*ld you have destroyed cities; Even*ld their memory has perished.
But*ld the Lord*s shall endure forever; He*ld has prepared His throne for judgment.
He*ld shall judge the world in righteousness, And*ld He shall administer judgment for the peoples in uprightness.
The*ln Lord*s also will be a refuge for the oppressed, A*ld refuge in times of trouble.
And*ld those who know Your name will put their trust in You; For*ld You, Lord,*s have not forsaken those who seek You.
Sing*ln praises to the Lord,*s who dwells in Zion! Declare*ld His deeds among the people.
When*ld He avenges blood, He remembers them; He*ld does not forget the cry of the humble.
Have*ln mercy on me, O Lord!*s Consider*ld my trouble from those who hate me, You*ld who lift me up from the gates of death,
That*ld I may tell of all Your praise In*ld the gates of the daughter of Zion. I*ld will rejoice in Your salvation.
The*ln nations have sunk down in the pit which*i they made; In*ld the net which they hid, their own foot is caught.
The*ld Lord*s is known by*i the judgment He executes; The*ld wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Meditation.*pc Selah*ipg
The*pn wicked shall be turned into hell, And*ild all the nations that forget God.
For*ld the needy shall not always be forgotten; The*ld expectation of the poor shall not*i perish forever.
Arise,*ln O Lord,*s Do*ld not let man prevail; Let*ld the nations be judged in Your sight.
Put*ld them in fear, O Lord,*s That*ild the nations may know themselves to*i be*i but*i men. Selah*ipg
